samples.question: >> What app do you use the most on your phone?
samples.transcript: The app that I use most on my phone, there are actually two. The first is the browser. I it is it is there. it is always available for information and anything and it I kind of use it as a reminder as well. I just keep tab open for the things I am going to do and also Instagram social media.

samples.question: >> Do you ever try to limit your screen time?

samples.question: What new technology would you like to own in the future?
samples.transcript: A piece of technology that I would like to own in the future that is new would be the premium version of AI models specifically chat GPT because I have been using them but mostly free versions. Anytime I tried the pro versions I use them in a shared manner and that just lags my whole process down. So like the undivided attention of that AI so yes I would want to own a premium version of that. >> Okay.

So like the undivided attention of that AI so yes I would want to own a premium version of that. >> Okay.

samples.question: Have you ever had any problems with technology?
samples.transcript: I would not say I had much that level of difficulty with technology. The main reason would be that I am Gen Z and my generation is also known as digital natives which means my whole generation has been brought up with technology. We have been exposed to technology as we were kids. It comes to us naturally. >> Okay.
samples.transcript_original: I wouldn't say I had much that level of difficulty with technology. The main reason would be that I am Gen Z and my generation is also known as digital natives which means my whole generation has been brought up with technology. We have been exposed to technology as we were kids. It comes to us naturally. >> Okay.
samples.transcript_cleaned: I would not say I had much that level of difficulty with technology. The main reason would be that I am Gen Z and my generation is also known as digital natives which means my whole generation has been brought up with technology. We have been exposed to technology as we were kids. It comes to us naturally. >>

samples.question: Would you like to start now, please?
samples.transcript: >> Yes, sir. A time where technology has greatly helped me in my modern life, I would say, was a time when I was trying to go to a place I did not know. My sister was there with me. And since we did not know, we wanted to use Google Maps to get there. And she put Google Maps on, the location was set and we were going I was driving. So while driving, she was giving me directions. But at one point, I did not feel like it was enough. So I kind of took the phone from her and in I in my way took it on my hand and was turning the map around east and west, swiping up and down trying to understand where it was. And that is when she jokingly said to me like you always spin the map around and look like in olden times when people had maps in their hand they used to hold it northwest and spin it around and look and I started laughing as well because it is kind of true and that moment that joke kind of made me realize it is very true how technology has changed my life. If I did not have Google maps with me I would be re actually holding a real life map in front of me and I would be actually spinning it around as I was driving. I do not have to do that now. I drive and the map kind of sometimes even tells me 400 meters to the right, turn left, go to this intersection, keep on straight. I do not have to look at the map all the time. It tells me and I like I can spin it much easier as well. it is not a huge piece of paper I have to spin. it is just a small screen that I can turn around with my fingers. >> Thank you very much.

samples.question: How has technology changed the way people communicate?
samples.transcript: >> Technology has made the way people communicate much faster and efficient than it used to be in the past. And I would rather use one word to describe it which is instantaneous. any you can get information like communication even in real time that was not possible 100 years ago but now it is. >> Yeah.

samples.question: Do you think technology helps people become more productive or more destructive?

samples.question: What are some negative effects of being dependent on technology?
samples.transcript: >> The biggest negative effect I would say of being dependent on technology is a colloquial phrase you hear people say sometimes to people who are very dependent on technology is go touch grass. >> Because when people become really dependent on technology, they do not want to even leave their homes. They do not go out. They do not see the sunlight. they are not touching grass. And they are even losing their ability to have basic conversations with people. >> That happens technologically. I would say you would be technologically crippled >> by that point. >> Okay.

samples.question: How can governments ensure technology is used responsibly?
samples.transcript: >> there are two main ways government would be able to ensure technology is being used responsibly. First would be on a personal level and the second would be on an industrial level. on personal levels. It cannot you know it cannot tell everybody or monitor what everyone's doing. That would be totalitarian. So it would have to educate people on the uses of technology and promote healthy habits. >> But as for the industrial use technology, they can have pollution permits and fines and all other regulatory systems that people do not misuse technology to pollute or do anything negative with it. >> Okay.
samples.transcript_original: >> Uh there are two main ways government would be able to ensure technology is being used responsibly. First would be on a personal level and the second would be on an industrial level. on personal levels. It cannot uh you know it cannot tell everybody or monitor what everyone's doing. That would be totalitarian. So it would have to educate people on the uses of technology and promote healthy habits. >> But as for the industrial use technology, they can have pollution permits and fines and all other regulatory systems that people do not misuse technology to pollute or do anything negative with it. >> Okay.

samples.question: Do you think future generations will use technology differently from today?
samples.transcript: >> Definitely 100% future generations will use technology differently than the current generation. The proof lies with history. We use technology much different than our parents. Our parents are much more advanced than our grandparents. And the story goes on.
samples.transcript_original: >> Definitely 100% future generations will use technology differently than the current generation. The proof lies with history. We use technology much different than our parents. Our parents are much more advanced than our grandparents. And the story goes on.

samples.question: >> In what ways?
samples.transcript: Efficiency. Efficiency. like if we go to our parents generation, they had the MP3 player or the Walkman. >> So if they wanted to listen to music, there was this bulky Walkman on their pants tied to their belt or on their pants with a headphone with wires. And they thought they were cool with that. >> Carry on the shoulders. >> Oh, the boom box. The one on the shoulders. And then you have us. We have AirPods this tiny. It goes in our ears. does not even have wires with our phones that can do so much more. the phones our phone it calls it records photos it is a radio and so many more things imagine if you had to carry all of them so we got efficient and the same thing will happen to the future generations as well the devices we have a lot of devices they will consolidate into one >> and they will not have to do that what we do >> what role will artificial intelligence play in everyday life in the next 10 20 years in your opinion >> in my opinion I would say artificial intelligence would take the role of the assistant of people. It is not going to take the jobs of people as people fear or maybe it may. I do I I cannot be an all I am I am not a future predictor but from what I can see it does not have that level of creativity or that level of fine-tuned human execution. It can help but it cannot do things for you. So let whatever the job is be it legal be it construction be it medical be it studio creativity artificial intelligence will help you to get what you get done what you need to get done and at times it it is also going to make things easier for you the more boring repetitive ts it is not going to you can do it much faster because of it but it is not going to take take your job it is going to make your job easier for you Okay, thank you.

samples.question: Do you live in a small town or a big city?
samples.transcript: >> Right now, I am actually living in this big city, which is right next to the mega city, Shanghai. where it only takes around like half an hour's train ride to get there. Yeah, it is called Sujo.

samples.question: >> What do you like most about living there?
samples.transcript: >> I like the, you know, I I like the facilities it offers. you know, the malls. sometimes when you get bored, you can just, wandering around and doing some window shopping and also the parks, you know, everything. I I love it here.
